titleStmt.title: To JAMES M’GREGOR,James M’Gregor (1808-58), of 4 Gloucester Square, Chairman of the South- Eastern Railway (resigned 1855). CD, who consistently misspells the name, referred to him as “a friend” (Vol. VI, p. 415) and approached him directly in 1853 about acquiring a piece of land for Miss Coutts’s Model House (Pilgrim Letters 7). [24 SEPTEMBER 1851]
